titleStmt.title: Description of Special Collections, Lehigh Codex 23: Gradual
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

availability.licence: These images and the content of Special Collections Lehigh Codex 23: Gradual are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Lehigh University Libraries, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Special Collections Lehigh Codex 23: Gradual. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

notesStmt.note: Front pastedown appears to be pages from a sixteenth-century Antiphonal printed on paper, possibly Venetian (per Marianne C.E. Gillion): Psalm 123 followed by an antiphon (with four-line stave in red ink and black square-note neumes); back pastedown from same Antiphonal: Psalm 118: 98-109, antiphon is 006889 in the Cantus Index

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a Gradual, in Latin, fifteenth-century manuscript on parchment, written in Italy. Originally 188 folios, now 175 folios. Bound in original wooden boards and brown leather.

supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation in red ink, Roman numerals, upper center recto; later foliation (17th century?) in ink, upper right recto, through fol. 30

p.catchwords: Regular catchwords, lower middle verso: fol. 8v, 16v, 24v, 32v, 40v, 48v, 56v, 64v, 72v, 80v, 88v, 96v, 112v, 120v, 128v, 142v, 150v, 158v, 174v, 182v

layoutDesc.layout: Single column, seven rows of text in black ink interspersed with seven four-line staves in red ink, with black square-note neumes

decoDesc.decoNote: Three miniatures, many decorated initials, musical notation
167rMusical notation added in the bottom margin

binding.p: Original binding, wooden boards and brown leather; pastedowns from a 16th century printed Antiphonal, possibly Venetian (per Marianne C.E. Gillion)
